total_impedance_ori_txt.item: Ze and R connected in series so Zd=Ze+R='38.5 / 78°'Ohm
Zc and Zd connected in parallel so Zb=Zc*Zd/(Zc+Zd)='26.4 / -81.8°'Ohm
Zb and Zf connected in series so Za=Zb+Zf='31.7 / -83.2°'Ohm

total_impedance_txt.item: j*w*L and R connected in series so Zd=j*w*L+R='38.5 / 78°'Ohm
1/(j*w*C) and Zd connected in parallel so Zb=1/(j*w*C)*Zd/(1/(j*w*C)+Zd)='26.4 / -81.8°'Ohm
Zb and 1/(j*w*C1) connected in series so Za=Zb+1/(j*w*C1)='31.7 / -83.2°'Ohm

solution.item: *** Solution by TINA assisted by AI ***
This is an AC calculation
We know that generator frequency is f=1k Hz, w=2*pi*f
At first we calculate the total impedance between the generator nodes (V)
j*w*L and R connected in series so Zd=j*w*L+R='38.5 / 78°'Ohm
1/(j*w*C) and Zd connected in parallel so Zb=1/(j*w*C)*Zd/(1/(j*w*C)+Zd)='26.4 / -81.8°'Ohm
Zb and 1/(j*w*C1) connected in series so Za=Zb+1/(j*w*C1)='31.7 / -83.2°'Ohm
The total impedance is Za = '31.7 / -83.2°'Ohm
Now we calculate the current on L
We know that the voltage between V nodes is '10 / 0°'V.
(1) The components Zb,1/(j*w*C1) connected in series.
(1) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is '10 / 0°'V.
(1) Zb is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Zb is Zb/Za*'10 / 0°'V = '8.34 / 1.37°'V.
(1) The current on Zb is the 'voltage on Zb / Zb' = '316m / 83.2°'A .
(2) The components 1/(j*w*C),Zd connected in parallel. The voltage on Zd is '8.34 / 1.37°'V because the voltage on Zb is '8.34 / 1.37°'V
(3) The components j*w*L,R connected in series.
(3) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is '8.34 / 1.37°'V.
(3) j*w*L is in the voltage divider so the voltage on j*w*L is Ze/Zd*'8.34 / 1.37°'V = '8.16 / 13.3°'V.
(3) The current on j*w*L is the 'voltage on j*w*L / Ze' = '216m / -76.7°'A .
(4) The voltage on L is '8.16 / 13.3°'V because the voltage is '8.16 / 13.3°'V on j*w*L
(4) The current on L is the 'voltage on L / j*w*L' = '216m / -76.7°'A .
To answer the original question: because the I2 ampermeter connected to L in series so the current on I2 is '216m / 103°'A
We have considered also that the direction of the ampermeter does not match the current direction on L
We have considered also the sign of the current on L
